name: Camellia
description: Camellia is a genus of about 250 species of evergreen shrubs and trees in the Theaceae family, native to eastern Asia.Their perfectly shaped blooms come in a remarkable range of sizes, colors and forms. It is always lovely to see these long-blooming flowers in the garden. Camellias thrive best in partially shaded areas because they are sensitive to bright light. They are great for balconies, terraces, woodland gardens or in containers.
meaning: The genus was named in honor of Georg Joseph Kamel (1661-1706), sometimes spoken of as the “Father Camellus”, who was a Jesuit missionary, pharmacist and naturalist.
color_description: Camellia offers a large palette of colors, from white to yellow, pink red and purple.
